context_bundle.summary: Pytest: Python testing framework with powerful features. Simple syntax (assert keyword), fixtures for setup/teardown, parametrization, plugins. Features: Auto-discovery (test_*.py), detailed failure reports, markers (@pytest.mark), parallel execution (pytest-xdist), coverage (pytest-cov). Fixtures: @pytest.fixture for reusable setup. Parametrize: @pytest.mark.parametrize for data-driven tests. Plugins: pytest-django, pytest-asyncio, pytest-mock. Run: pytest (all tests), pytest test_file.py (specific file), pytest -k 'test_name' (pattern matching), pytest -v (verbose).

onboarding.quick_start: Pytest: pip install pytest. Write tests: def test_addition(): assert 1 + 1 == 2; def test_string(): assert 'hello'.upper() == 'HELLO'. Run: pytest (discovers test_*.py or *_test.py files). Fixtures: @pytest.fixture def db_connection(): conn = create_connection(); yield conn; conn.close(); def test_query(db_connection): result = db_connection.query('SELECT 1'); assert result == [(1,)]. Parametrize: @pytest.mark.parametrize('input,expected', [(2, 4), (3, 9), (0, 0)]) def test_square(input, expected): assert square(input) == expected. Markers: @pytest.mark.slow def test_heavy_computation(): ...; Run: pytest -m slow. Parallel: pytest -n auto (pytest-xdist). Coverage: pytest --cov=myapp --cov-report=html. Config: pytest.ini or pyproject.toml [tool.pytest.ini_options].
common_patterns: Basic test: def test_list_operations(): lst = [1, 2, 3]; assert len(lst) == 3; assert 2 in lst; lst.append(4); assert lst[-1] == 4
Fixture: @pytest.fixture(scope='session') def api_client(): client = TestClient(); yield client; client.close()
Parametrize: @pytest.mark.parametrize('email,valid', [('test@example.com', True), ('invalid', False), ('', False)]) def test_email_validation(email, valid): assert is_valid_email(email) == valid
Exception testing: def test_division_by_zero(): with pytest.raises(ZeroDivisionError): divide(10, 0); with pytest.raises(ValueError, match='negative'): process(-1)

Markers: @pytest.mark.integration def test_database(): ...; @pytest.mark.skip(reason='Not implemented') def test_future(): ...; @pytest.mark.skipif(sys.version_info < (3, 8), reason='Requires Python 3.8+')

Fixture scopes: @pytest.fixture(scope='function') # default, per test; @pytest.fixture(scope='class') # per class; @pytest.fixture(scope='module') # per module; @pytest.fixture(scope='session') # once per session
Conftest.py: # Shared fixtures across tests; @pytest.fixture def sample_data(): return {'key': 'value'}; # Auto-discovered in all test files
Pytest-xdist (parallel): pytest -n 4 (4 workers), pytest -n auto (CPU count)
Config (pytest.ini): [pytest]; testpaths = tests; python_files = test_*.py; python_classes = Test*; python_functions = test_*; markers = slow: marks tests as slow; integration: integration tests
